frontmatter.summary: Setting up Metadata Menu a Obsidian Plugin about front matter.

Class \"all\".description: Main class, All the other classes belong to this one, the current properties being applied by the other classes.
bullets: `ai`: Select type. Between no or yes. Used to select which notes should be indexed by AI.
`status`: Select type. Between Planned, in-progress, on-hold, blocked, cancelled, done. Used to set the status of the project or task.
`project`: File type. Used to link tasks and references to project pages.
`created`: Date type. Used to set when the file was created.
`summary`: Input type. Used to make a small summary of the content inside the file.
`tags`: Select type. Get tags from file 03-resources/01-obsidian/lookout/l-Tags. Used to ensure consistent tagging across notes. They use hierarchy to make easier to find topics.

Class \"projects\".description:
Project notes are created in order to centralize all the tasks and references around a single note for be easy to track everything related to a project. Multiple projects can be selected, they come in a array format e.g.
projects:
  - "[[project-1]]"
  - "[[project-2]]"
This class have little to no human input, almost all information is added via queries beside the Overview about the project.
bullets:
-`projectDuration`: Lookup type. Sums the duration between all tasks associated with this project.
-`startDate`: Date type. Date that the project started.
-`endDate`: Date type. Date that the project finished.

Class \"references\".description: Used in order to create deep-dive notes about certain tasks or projects, any support file goes into this category. No especial properties are used besides the ones in all.

Class \"tasks\".description:
Huge task lists around a specific topic. In the beginning it was used to track a single task, however thanks to the plugin "tasks" now I have a better way to track single tasks. So this file now is to have tasks lists.
I wonder if I could insert all tasks inside the project files, but I prefer to keep it separated because my project files have too many dataview queries, this way I can easily share the tasks and it let me create smaller files for each step in a project.
**Bullets*
- `duration`: Number type. Used to track my time under each task, it is incremeneted in steps of 10 minutes.

Class \"readme.md\".description: This class will be deprecated soon, it was used to create README.md files for GitHub temporary but it is unecessary.

Class Config Locations.description: Each Class need a config folder that is located in `03-resources/01-obsidian/class/` Some "Selection" fields need a lookout file located in `03-resources/01-obsidian/lookout/`

Parking Lot.description: Future improvements or ideas for metadata menu classes or properties.
bullets: `author`: Text type. If I have multiple authors or want to track who created the note.

`Personal`: Class type, which will include travel, cooking, finance, health, creative categories, properties date and location. The necessity of this class in currently being evaluated due to the author not having a life.
`personal/travel`: Class type, which will include destination
`personal/cooking`: Class type, could include cuisine and rating
`personal/finance`: Class type, include amount, transaction type
`personal/health`: Class type, include type like workout, doctor appointment
`personal/creative`: Class type, music, anime, movies things that I watch/enjoy.
`learning`: Class type, Category Select between course, book, article, video. used to keep track of learning material, maybe.
